    Welcome to the Open CR Project

     

    This project was launched by the Continuum Robotics Laboratory (CRL) at the University of Toronto in 2022. After a decade of research on continuum robotics, the time is right for us to empower the world with open hardware and open software to build their own continuum robots. With our blog, we are filling the gap between continuum robotics research papers and general robotics knowledge to provide entry-level educational content. We also cover best practices, historical perspectives, research news, etc.

     

    OpenCR Blog

    Entry level educational content, advanced research results, historical perspectives, and hands-on posts.

    Learn More

    CRVisToolkit

    A set of MATLAB functions for visualization and plotting of continuum robots. And utility functions to support your research.

    Learn More

    OpenCR Hardware

    Actuation Module: CAD drawings, components, assembly instructions, code, etc. for you to build a continuum robot for research.

    Learn More

    Are you interested in contributing to the Open Continuum Robotics Project? Get in touch
